Text.Page:
Marching Orders

Enemy troops are gathering in Arcadia.

Come find me to set out towards Arcadia.

Report to Vanguard Initiative Garrison Commander Samael in Arun.
<PCNAME> helped heal soldiers in Oblivion Woods, and learned about the devas.

Crescentia needs our help. There are devas raiding supply lines throughout the area.

Centurion Neacal is launching counter-operations from a command post at Bulwark Camp in Oblivion Woods.

See what you can do to help him."How do I get there?"

How do you get there?

Is that thing on your shoulders just an accessory?
I don't care if you take the pegasus, use a scroll, or even walk.

We don't have time for games. Move it!"Yes, sir!"
(Get help from Dougal.)
(Get help from Getty.)

(Get help from Uriela.
Dougal seems busy, and Getty wouldn't know.)

I've heard what you did on the Island of Dawn.

I'm glad that you joined our forces. So, what brings you here. Is there anything I can help?"How can I get to the Bulwark Camp in Oblivion Woods?"

Bulwark Camp in Oblivion Woods?
Yes, I do recall that they asked for reinforcements.

Take a ride on the Pegasus to Crescentia. You can use the teleportal in the town when you get there.

Say "Hello" to Ferus for me. He's an old friend.

The Flight Manager will help you with the Pegasus. Good luck.

! It's a pleasure to see you again.
You're not running out of inventory already are you?

What? Bulwark Camp in Oblivion Woods?

Ah, so that's what the fuss was all about.
That's pretty heavy responsibility for a first mission!"How can I get there?"

Teleport scrolls are the most handy if you ask me!
Bulwark Camp... you'll get there in no time once you go to Lumbertown.

Let's see... where is it...?
Voila! Here it is.

You can use this scroll.
Take it, it's on me."Thank you."

You're heading for Arcadia?

It's because of Crescentia isn't it?
It's your lucky day. I just got teleport scrolls, so please take some with you.

It'll take you straight to the Oblivion Woods.

Bulwark Camp in Oblivion Woods?

Sorry. I don't think there's a direct flight.
The fastest way would be using the teleportal in Crescentia.

[Take a pegasus and go to Crescentia.]
"I will."

Don't forget. It's Crescentia!
You'll have to take another ride if you go someplace else.

You're ! I've heard about you from Dougal.

Especially what you did at the Island of Dawn. On behalf of Crescentia, I thank you.

This is from Dougal.
He said that you'll need this.
"Thank you."

On your right is the teleportal; you can use it to go to the Bulwark Camp. Neacal is waiting for you.

Good luck.

Welcome to Lumbertown.

You can call me Arn, I'm the Magistrate.
I assume that you're from the Federation. What takes you to Lumbertown?"I'm on my way to the Bulwark Camp in the Oblivion Woods."

Yes, indeed I see.

Follow the path towards the Pegasus Platform, and you'll be there in no time.

If you need more help, Latton will guide you."Thank you."

Are you my "reinforcements?" Well, at least you seem like you've had some experience.

Welcome to Bulwark Camp, the halfway point between Lumbertown and Crescentia.

We try to keep the road clear of devas, but they're starting to raid the towns now, and we need to protect the townspeople."How can I help?"

First things first: We need medicine. We've got a lot of wounded soldiers, and we've run out of supplies.

If we had more Sorrow Flowers, we could make some healing poultices. We've sent out a few foraging parties, but they keep running into sabertooths-which just makes for more wounded. Think you can fight your way through them and collect some Sorrow Flowers?"You can count on me."

Here, take this sickle with you.
It's not the best in the world, but you'll have no problem gathering Sorrow Flowers with it.

You can gather with or without tools, but the right tool will save you a lot of time, so you should learn how to use it.

Once you're near the object, you'll know which tool to use.

This is a Teleportal.

It's linked with various places in Arcadia.

[Select teleport and go to Bulwark Camp in Oblivion Woods.]

Stop! Where are you going?

Up ahead is the Oblivion Woods, and you're nothing but fresh meat to those monsters if you don't have what it takes.

I've heard that even devas are out there.

I'd go there and help out if I could but..."I'm on my way to help them out."

So you're from the Federation?

You should have said so!
Neacal will be more than glad to see you.
Just go straight ahead past the cave."Thank you."

Take this healing pouch to Neacal for me.
They're short on supplies with all the battles.
If you can, please take down some sabertooths near the cave. They've been causing too much harm to the villagers.
"Got it."

On your way, you'll see some Sorrow Flowers. Gather them. Since we're short on healing supplies, the flowers will come in handy.

Here, take this sickle with you.
It's not the best in the world, but you'll have no problem gathering Sorrow Flowers with it.

You can gather with or without tools, but the right tool will save you a lot of time, so you should learn how to use it.

Once you're near the object, you'll know which tool to use.

Are you my "reinforcements?" Well, at least you seem like you've had some experience.

Welcome to Bulwark Camp, the halfway point between Lumbertown and Crescentia.

We try to keep the road clear of devas, but they're starting to raid the towns now, and we need to protect the townspeople."How can I help?"

First things first: We need medicine. We've got a lot of wounded soldiers, and we've run out of supplies.

If we had more Sorrow Flowers, we could make some healing poultices. We've sent out a few foraging parties, but they keep running into sabertooths-which just makes for more wounded. Think you can fight your way through them and collect some Sorrow Flowers?"You can count on me."

Here, take this sickle with you.
It's not the best in the world, but you'll have no problem gathering Sorrow Flowers with it.

You can gather with or without tools, but the right tool will save you a lot of time, so you should learn how to use it.

Once you're near the object, you'll know which tool to use.

Well done, !

The hard part is over... now we just need to apply the poultices to the wounded.

Start with these two, will you? And don't take no for an answer! I know the poultices don't smell too good, but it's the fastest way to get them back on their feet and in fighting shape!

Have you gathered the flowers?
Just to be safe, you should get rid of any sabertooth nearby before you start gathering.

Well done, !

The hard part is over... now we just need to apply the poultices to the wounded.

Start with these two, will you? And don't take no for an answer! I know the poultices don't smell too good, but it's the fastest way to get them back on their feet and in fighting shape!

Have you gathered the flowers?
Just to be safe, you should get rid of any sabertooth nearby before you start gathering.

Are you my "reinforcements?" Well, at least you seem like you've had some experience.

Welcome to Bulwark Camp, the halfway point between Lumbertown and Crescentia.

We try to keep the road clear of devas, but they're starting to raid the towns now, and we need to protect the townspeople."How can I help?"

Patching up the wounded soldiers is first.
We're out of supplies though...

I think the Sorrow Flowers nearby can help."Latton sent this."

Latton did what...?

I'm speechless at all the support he's provided. Please aid the soldiers.

It's going to help them a lot.I'll use the flowers you brought, in case of any emergencies.

Have you gathered the flowers?
Just to be safe, you should get rid of any sabertooth nearby before you start gathering.

*retch*... *spit*...!
You're not putting that stuff on me!

Do you have any idea how sensitive my sense of smell is?

Just let me die..."Come on, the centurion's watching..."

Is this actual medicine...?

I was wondering when we could get something more than the Sorrow Flowers.
I'm feeling better already."You hang in there."

Whoa! Wait! What is that you're putting on me?

It smells like Cutthroat Harbor at low tide!

Oh, I think I'm going to throw up...!"Just breathe through your mouth."

Thank you.
I can get back in battle anytime now.

I can't wait to deal with those devas again.

"That's the spirit."

Quit complaining! I know what that tastes like.

You'll be back in shape in no time.

Thank you, .

You gathered the flowers with that {@RawItem:206600}, didn't you?

Each object has a tool that's suited to it. You should know which one to use once you're near a given object.

Here, take these. They should help you on your journey.
Thanks again, .
